summary: This bill, the "Pay Workers What They’ve Earned Act," amends Title 31 of the United States Code to provide reimbursement for employees of the Federal Government, District of Columbia, federal contractors, and States for costs incurred due to government shutdowns. The bill defines "covered employee" and "shutdown cost," outlining how reimbursements will be handled, and establishes a Reserve Fund for Employees Affected By Government Shutdowns. States can also be reimbursed for certain assistance program payments during shutdowns.
